accommodation.name: Rihga Royal Hotel Hiroshima
accommodation.transportation: Next to Kenchomae Station (Exit 2); 5 minute walk from Kamiya-cho Higashi or Nishi stations

transportation.notes: To hotel: From Hiroshima Station South exit, take Hiroden/Streetcar Line #1, #2, or #6 (bound for Hiroshima Port) to Kamiyacho-Nishi Station (approx. 6 minutes) - under own expense

itinerary.activities: Morning visit to Kenroku-en garden and Kanazawa Castle; Evening at leisure in Hiroshima
itinerary.recommendations: Visit Kenroku-en garden ('Six Attributes Garden') and adjacent Kanazawa Castle

transportation.tickets: Covered by Hiroshima 1-Day Streetcar & Ferry Pass

transportation.notes: Shortest route from Peace Park; Motoyasu Pier located 50m south of Atomic Bomb Dome

pass.name: Hiroshima 1-Day Streetcar & Ferry Pass
pass.coverage: Unlimited travel on Hiroden tram and Matsudai ferry
pass.not_valid_for: JR West trains, JR Miyajima Ferry

itinerary.activities: Morning: Hiroshima Peace Memorial Park and Museum; Afternoon: Ferry to Miyajima to see Itsukushima Shrine and floating torii gate; Optional cable car or hike up Mount Misen (530m); Look for maple leaf shaped cakes
highlights: Hiroshima Peace Memorial Park and Museum
Miyajima Island - UNESCO World Heritage Site
Itsukushima Shrine with floating torii gate
Local maple leaf shaped cakes (momiji manju)

accommodation.name: Hotel Gracery Kyoto Sanjo
accommodation.japanese_address: 〒604-8035 京都府京都市中京区桜之町４２０
accommodation.transportation: 5-minute walk from Exit #5 of Kyoto Shiyakusho-mae station (Subway Tozai Line); 8-minute walk from Sanjo station (Keihan line and Subway Tozai Line)

transportation.notes: To hotel: From Kyoto Station, take Karasuma Subway Line to Karasuma-Oike (6 min), then Tozai Subway Line to Kyoto Shiyakusho-mae (2 min) - under own expense; OR take taxi

itinerary.notes: Use Kyoto guide on Self Guide app

itinerary.activities: Day trip to Nara: Visit Nara Park (Deer Park), Todai-ji Temple (world's largest wooden building), Kasuga-taisha Shrine
highlights: Todai-ji Temple - world's largest wooden building
Kasuga-taisha - Nara's most celebrated Shinto shrine
itinerary.notes: Use Nara guide on Self Guide app; Nara was Japan's capital in 8th Century

oversized_luggage_shinkansen.rule: For Tokaido (Tokyo-Osaka), Sanyo (Osaka-Fukuoka), and Kyushu (Fukuoka-Kagoshima) Shinkansen lines
oversized_luggage_shinkansen.under_160cm: Can be placed in front of seat or overhead rack without reservation
oversized_luggage_shinkansen.161_250cm: Must reserve special seat with oversized baggage area
oversized_luggage_shinkansen.over_250cm: Cannot be brought on bullet trains
oversized_luggage_shinkansen.recommendation: Consider forwarding luggage between hotels and bringing smaller overnight luggage

ic_cards.purpose: Prepaid transport card for trains, buses, convenience stores, vending machines
types: ICOCA (from ticket machines, no personal details)
Welcome Suica (at Travel Service Centers at major stations and airports)
ic_cards.recommended: PASMO app for iPhone users - easiest option

luggage_forwarding.arrangement: Liaise with hotel staff and pay locally
luggage_forwarding.recommendation: Keep overnight bag for nights in Yudanaka and Matsumoto

kamikochi_recommendations.avoid: Huge luggage (expensive to check, counter closes at 17:00)
kamikochi_recommendations.reservation: Make return bus reservation at Matsumoto Bus Terminal day before or morning of travel - fills up quickly

natural_disaster_protocol: Return to or stay at hotel so you can be located
If staying at hotel not possible, follow hotel instructions
If leaving hotel, contact Customer Care team and/or leave message at hotel

takayama.description: Castle town at base of Japanese Alps with beautifully preserved old town dating to Edo period (1603-1868)
highlights: Preserved inns, tea houses and shops
Sake breweries (high quality due to pure mountain water)
takayama.character: Traditional touch, easily explored on foot, relaxing contrast to Tokyo/Kyoto bustle

shirakawago.description: UNESCO World Heritage Site in remote Shogawa River Valley, famous for unique gassho-zukuri thatched wooden farmhouses
highlights: Traditional steep thatched roofs designed for heavy snow

kanazawa.description: One of Japan's wealthiest towns during 17th Century Edo period, now key cultural center
highlights: Kenroku-en garden (one of Japan's most beautiful)
kanazawa.character: Cultural and artistic center patronized by Maeda clan

hiroshima.description: Vibrant rebuilt city with wide streets, unique foods, important historical sites
hiroshima.character: Rebuilt after atomic bomb devastation, now vibrant and welcoming

miyajima.description: Sacred wooded island in Inland Sea with UNESCO World Heritage Itsukushima Shrine
highlights: Floating torii gate (most photographed site in Japan)
miyajima.significance: UNESCO World Heritage Site, relatively small and explorable on foot or by bike

kyoto.description: Japan's ancient capital, culturally rich city with extensive historical monuments
kyoto.significance: UNESCO World Heritage Site collection of monuments, mix of modern city and timeless scenes

nara.description: Japan's capital in 8th Century, center of Japanese culture and civilization
highlights: Nara Park (Deer Park) with tame deer
nara.character: Small town with many attractions around popular Nara Park
